problem.tex: Let $\Omega$ be a region, $a\in\Omega$, and $r>0$ such that $\overline{B_r(a)}\subset\Omega$. Let $f:\Omega\to\mathbb{C}$ be a holomorphic function. Suppose there is some $z\in B_r(a)$ such that \[|f(z)|=\sup_{w\in\overline{B_r(a)}}|f(w)|.\] Then $f$ is constant.

solution.tex: Suppose $f$ is nonconstant. Then, by the open mapping theorem, $f$ is an open map. Open maps cannot have the property which is the assumption of this theorem. Justification of this claim is easiest with a few pictures, which are easier to go over in person than in text.
